title: Why do I love listening to old music recently ? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think it could either be two things, one could be that you are sentimental for the music of your childhood. If that’s the case, I’ve been there. Recently I started listening to Blink 182 again. However that doesn’t speak to the quality of the music, it’s just my own sentimentality attached to it. Or it could be that older music is much better. Just consider the music of Postmodern Jukebox, which reimagines popular songs as 20s and 30s style, many of which are far superior than the original song. Here are some examples. Bad Romance - Lady Gaga (reimagined as a 1920's flapper style)  Umbrella - Rhianna Vintage (reimagined as a 1930s vaudeville type song)  As you can see, my favorite videos are the ones that feature the tap dancing women. You know what the best part if them is? They are captioned!

Old music has a unique vibe. New music, especially those starting from 2013 are way too perfect and edgy, and lyrics are also too complicated to get the message. Pop songs from the 60’s to 90’s have the right balance of perfect and emphasizes creativity, and it’s also really catchy that anyone can enjoy! I still listen to new music, but it has been a while since I last listened to English pop songs. I feel lost somewhere between Istanbul and Tokyo since 2016, but that’s okay.
